(Read this file in UTF-8 encoding)

-------------------------------------------------

Credit Card information encryptor/decryptor. Java Console Application made in Eclipse IDE using an external library (ensure to add it in build path): json-simple-1.1.jar

(In Eclipse IDE) Click on Window>Preferences>General>Workspace Here set Text File Encoding to Other: UTF-8

Create the following folders: C:/test/Sender and C:/test/Receiver

Create a .txt file titled "f1_InputPlainText" at C:/test/Sender

Write in this file the credit card info that you want to encrypt and send in this format:

<card number>.<exp date in MMYY>.<First Name>.<Last Name>.<CVV>.<misc info>

example:

8192602501863061.5687.Takumi D'Bunta.Fujiwara.569.Hey Guys!!! This is my card. I like to drift my AE-86 and have fun!

-------------------------------------------------

I made this Program as a Minor Credit Project in 2019 during my bachelor's education. Nothing groundbreaking or special in it, it's just a convoluted but still a secure model that encrypts and sends credit data through several existing algorithms. (It was pointless but still a good exercise to build an encryption application based on existing algorithms from scratch. Helped me learn and implement the mathematics involved in AES and RSA encryption models)

Algorithm flow:

Plain text data > Numbers "converted" to english alphabets > english alphabets converted to corresponding transliterate characters in Hindi (using Numeric Character Reference (NCR) Encoding) > Hindi characters transliterated to those in French (again using NCR) > AES encryption > RSA encryption > Sent to Receiver

Specs:

IEEE Standard FIPS PUB-197 128-bit AES Stream Cipher in Galois/Counter Mode of Operation

2048 BIT IEEE standard RSA using 64 Rounds of iterative Miller-Rabin Probabilistic tests and One Lucas Strong Deterministic Test

High Primality of primes used in RSA (~100%)

Apparent brute force attack time: 117.3 million years at 3.5 GHz


-------------------------------------------------

Example Console Output:





*****Sender begins*****

Input data is: 8192602501863061.5687.Takumi D'Bunta.Fujiwara.569.Hey Guys!!! This is my card. I like to drift my AE-86 and have fun!

Masked Text data is: IBJCGACFABIGDAGB.FGIH.Takumi D'Bunta.Fujiwara.FGJ.Hey Guys!!! This is my card. I like to drift my AE-86 and have fun!
